DOC.brief_summary: This single centre open label study measure low limb physiology patient venous leg ulcer University Hospital South Manchester . DOC.brief_title: A Study Patients With Venous Leg Ulcers Measuring Effects Using Geko™ Device
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age ≥ 18 year 2 . Intact healthy skin site device application 3 . Able understand Patient Information Sheet 4 . Willing able give inform consent 5 . Willing able follow requirement protocol 6 . Subjects chronic venous leg ulcer ( i.e . CEAP classification C6 1 ) great 1 cm2 less 10 cm maximum diameter , 7 . ABPI ≥0.8 8 . Patient treat 4 layer compression bandage 1 . Wound infection either acute chronic 2 . History significant haematological disorder DVT precede six month 3 . Pregnant 4 . Pacemakers implantable defibrillator 5 . Use neuromodulation device 6 . Current use TENS pelvic region , back legs 7 . Use investigational drug device within past 4 week may interfere study 8 . Recent surgery may affect study ( abdominopelvic , low limb ) opinion investigator . 9 . Recent trauma lower limbs 10 . Size leg incompatible geko™ device . 11 . Obesity ( BMI > 34 ) 12 . Any medication deem significant Investigator 13 . Subjects index venous leg ulcer great maximum diameter 10cm one dimension , less 2cm . 14 . Diabetes 15 . Clinical evidence peripheral arterial disease ( i.e sign symptom , opinion researcher )
